name: Nicknames And Grounds Quiz | UK | 15 Questions

questions.text: At which ground do 'The Lilywhites' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Deepdale.

	Preston North End are called 'The Lilywhites' and play at Deepdale.

questions.text: The Chairboys play their home games at _____ ?
questions.explanation:
Adams Park.

	Wycombe Wanderers are called 'The Chairboys' and play at Adams Park.

questions.text: At which ground do 'The Shrimpers' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Roots Hall.

	Southend United are called the Shrimpers and play at Roots Hall.

questions.text: At which ground do 'The Pilgrims' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Home Park.

	Plymouth Argylle are called 'The Pilgrims' and play at Home Park.

questions.text: At which ground did 'The Merry Millers' play from 1907 to 2008?
questions.explanation:
Millmoor.

	Rotherham United are called 'The Merry Millers' and played at Millmoor for over 100 years. They played four seasons at the Don Valley Stadium in nearby Sheffield until their new home ground was completed in 2012, in New York Way,  Rotherham (New York Stadium).

questions.text: At which ground did 'The Spireites' play until 2010?
questions.explanation:
Saltergate.

	Chesterfield are called 'The Spireites' and, from 1871 to 2010, played at The Recreation Ground, Saltergate. They moved to their new home ground in  Sheffield Road, Wittington Moor, Chesterfield at the start of the 2010-11 season.

questions.text: At which ground do 'The Mariners' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Blundell Park.

	Grimsby Town are called 'The Mariners' and play at Blundell Park.

questions.text: Which ground do 'The Saddlers' call home?
questions.explanation:
Bescot Stadium.

	Walsall are called 'The Saddlers' and play at the Bescot Stadium.

questions.text: Where do 'The Minstermen' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Bootham Crescent.

	York City are called 'The Minsterman' and play at Bootham Crescent.

questions.text: At which ground do 'The Railwaymen' play?
questions.explanation:
Gresty Road.

	Crewe Alexandra are called The Railwaymen and play at Gresty Road. Their home ground was renamed Alexandra Stadium in 2000.

questions.text: At which ground do 'The Cherries' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Dean Court.

	Bournemouth are called 'The Cherries' and play at Dean Court.

questions.text: At which ground did 'The Quakers' play from 1883 to 2003?
questions.explanation:
Feethams.

	Darlington are called 'The Quakers'. They were founded in 1883 and played at Feethams for 120 years.

questions.text: At which ground do 'The Gulls' play?
questions.explanation:
Plainmoor.

	Torquay United are called 'The Gulls' and play at Plainmoor.

questions.text: Where do 'The Posh' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
London Road.

	Peterborough United are called 'The Posh' and play at London Road.

questions.text: Where do 'The Shakers' play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Gigg Lane.

	Bury are called 'The Shakers' and play at Gigg Lane.
